zone.line: grief Sigismunda over the heart
of Guiscardo, I sat with my hands
folding folded, silently letting fall a
perpetual stream from my eyes.
Such was the depth of my emotion that
I had no feeling of what caused my
distress, my thoughts even wandered to
many indifferent objects; but still
neither moving limb or feature my
le I wept w tears fell untill, as if the
fountains were exhausted, they gra-
dually subsided, and I awoke to life
as from a dream
When I had ceased to weep
reason and memory returned upon
me, and I began to reflect with
greater calmness on what had ^happened, passed,
and how it became me to act – A few
hours ^only had passed but a mighty revo-
lution had taken place with regard
to me – the natural work of years
was over since had been tra^nsacted
since the morning: my father was as
